body:
Hey,

I have an old (working) phone. I'd like to use WhatsAPI on behalf of it's phone.
I DO know it's an API and not an app, however, the API requires a var which I don't know where I can get:
$userIdentity     = '00:00:00:00:00:00'; # This is tipically the IMEI number.
                                         # If you are using an iOS device you should input your WLAN MAC address.

The phone uses an old OS, I'm not even sure it's Symbian, it doesn't even have WiFi, and I definitely have no idea how I am going to get it's IMEI.

Is there any way to get WhatsAPI to work without the original IMEI?

Sincerely,
Adam.

comment_data.body:
yeah I already managed to do that on my original iPhone. thanks anyway!

So just to clear up things, the $token is simply a constant identifier for your phone? (which has nothing to do with your IMEI or you MAC Address)
That's right.

Hey,

I updated to the latest code. However, when I try to get a code to my phone (iPhone 4) I don't receive any.

I also tried the voice method, it said something about routing (no route, or something like that) and when trying the old phone\landline number I also don't get any call\sms.

on my iPhone 4 it said that the code has been sent but I didn't receive it...

I'm using the original code from EXAMPLE.php.

EDIT: tested on another phone, it says that the SMS has been sent but nothing's received. when trying the voice method this is what I get:

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'There was a problem trying to request the code.' in /************/whatsprot.class.php:296
Stack trace:
#0 /*******/src/php/EXAMPLES.php(62): WhatsProt->codeRequest('voice')
Update your code again

And make sure you use the example I posted here
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/402
MD5 identity doesn't seem to work anymore for WP7 client details
You need to generate one using SHA as shown in my example code

tested on another 3 phones. SMS is not received, then when I try the voice request I get 

stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail
    [reason] => no_routes
    [retry_after] => 3600
)

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'There was a problem trying to request the code.' in /************/WhatsAPI/src/php/whatsprot.class.php:296


EDIT: now tested on another phone, when trying voice without trying sms before, it does call me. but I don't receive any SMS from WhatsApp. and now on another phone (The fifth one!), and again received the "no routes" and voice failed.
Which identity did you use?
$identity = strtolower(urlencode(sha1($username, true)));

Strange
Tested it myself using voice:
- using md5 identity the server returned no_route
- using sha1 identity I get a phone call

it worked 1 of out 6 times for me. try it on another phone..

by the way, if it doesn't work properly on WP7, why don't you switch back to Android?

Because it works on WP7 if you use a SHA identity
Are you sure your version includes this commit?
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/commit/74223c1633cc9d664e6bee7d34f419aa1073a6b5

I've already reported seeing the new urlencoded SHA identity about 4 months ago. We can stick with MD5 identity (probably still working on Android for backwards compatibility) and wait for the inevitable to happen, or we can be ahead of the curve and use the latest formats and encoding.

I tested on couple of more phones. SMS is received but other than I myself, no one of my friends received a phone call (but some of them did receive SMS text).
[code]
Adams-Mac-mini:WhatsAPI adam$ git show
commit 74223c1633cc9d664e6bee7d34f419aa1073a6b5
Author: Max Kovaljov <shirioko@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 11 11:21:21 2013 +0200

    Moved back to WP7 client details
    
    Also modified code request to match query string sent by WP7 client
    I WILL MAKE THIS WORK!!1! D:<

diff --git a/src/php/whatsprot.class.php b/src/php/whatsprot.class.php
index 8d16c86..a8fc8f9 100644
--- a/src/php/whatsprot.class.php
+++ b/src/php/whatsprot.class.php
@@ -22,10 +22,10 @@ class WhatsProt
     const WHATSAPP_REQUEST_HOST = 'v.whatsapp.net/v2/code';      // The request
     const WHATSAPP_SERVER = 's.whatsapp.net';               // The hostname use
     const WHATSAPP_UPLOAD_HOST = 'https://mms.whatsapp.net/client/iphone/upload
-    const WHATSAPP_DEVICE = 'Android';                      // The device name.
-    const WHATSAPP_VER = '2.10.750';                        // The WhatsApp ver
-    const WHATSAPP_TOKEN = '30820332308202f0a00302010202044c2536a4300b06072a864
-    const WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT = 'WhatsApp/2.10.750 Android/4.2.1 Device/GalaxyS
+    const WHATSAPP_DEVICE = 'WP7';                      // The device name.
+    const WHATSAPP_VER = '2.9.4';                        // The WhatsApp versio

[/code]

Take a look here
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/402
You need to hash the identity using SHA now. And download the latest code.

You can't replicate your identity when your number is registered using a smartphone, it's constructed by your phone and we don't know how it works. Easiest way to get it is to use MissVenom

@shirioko  Yes ,i had a try,and i can get the password by the code and the password is valid.
But i have a question.the param "id" got by the code is not the same as sinffed  by  MissVenom before.

The log of code getting password：
 [cc] => 86
 [in] => xxx
 [to] => 86xxx
 [lg] => en
 [lc] => CN
 [method] => sms
 [mcc] => 460
 [mnc] => 001
 [token] => 799cac66d677bc5490bad38f007d82d9
 [id] => %3bf%a7%fb%07g%c8%b3y%83%0e%9a%aa0+u%7e%df%2a%e1

The log of MissVenom(sinff before)：
https://v.whatsapp.net/v2/exist?cc=86&in=xx&id=%18%D3%34%B5%6F%61%40%B5%93%D4%42%19%6F%B5%33%01&lg=zh&lc=CN

Of course not, as I said before we don't know how to reproduce a device's identity.
You can only sniff it out using MissVenom and then reuse it in WhatsApi, or create another valid identity using SHA hashing

I see,Your expression is so strict.
Thanks very much.

how can i get registered code...
help me
Just use WART ffs

What is it mr...
Can you give me some articles or tutorials
Pada 4 Feb 2014 09.11, "Max Kovaljov" <notifications@github.com> menulis:

> Just use WART ffs
>
> --
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/401#issuecomment-34041720>
> .
>

Then why did I bother creating a GUI?
https://github.com/shirioko/WART

can you give me how to get username and password in whatsapp or getting
registered user....
i new in android.


2014-02-04 Max Kovaljov <notifications@github.com>:

> Then why did I bother creating a GUI?
> https://github.com/shirioko/WART
>
> --
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/401#issuecomment-34041966>
> .
>
I am trying to use the API today , after whatsapp new updates and i cant figure out how to get the password , as Whatsapp has blocked all there previous methods
https://github.com/shirioko/WART
Thanks , I have gone through it , I am using MAC OS and its a .exe file
I tried in a Window machine , I got the password , but when i am trying to open whatsapp.php and trying to connect it says Password is wrong
Try exampleFunctional.php first to see if your username and password are correct
Hi, I have the password using WART, how do we get the ID? Thanks

ID is only relevant during registration. You don't need an identity if you already have a password.
But if you really really really want one, you can enter your phone number in WART and press the [Identity] button.

Hi Shirioko. Great job with this api buddy. Quick question I have my password but as you say id is not important, I have a defaut value there. and my call is $w = new WhatsProt($username, 123456789, "WhatsHapnin", true);
Problem: I can receivee mmesssages to the  ajaxDemo from mmy phone, but I cannot sen messages .....WTF!!!!???? Wha does that mean?
I have set default to true but I am not gettin any debug info in my browser(firefox).....
What am I mising???? Been stuck here for days now. Please help!!!!!

I think your keys are also stuck.

You need to uncomment lines 38-42 to enable debug output
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/src/php/ajaxDemo/index.php#L38

Yeah Im using a wireless keyboard and baterryrunning out. Thanks for that
So why does it refuse to send when I am receiving? Can I receive if I am blocked?

Idk, uncomment the debug lines and find out

No you won't be able to log in when your number is blocked, so no sending or receiving.
I just did and refresh on ajaxDemo but its still not showing debug info on the  page
I am at an absolute loss as to what is happening :(

Debug info will appear after a minute of running:
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/src/php/ajaxDemo/socket.php#L2

Set the time limit to 10-30 seconds for more frequent debug output
Okay I changed it to 30 secs anndI am now receivng mmesssages and senddign! But still no dbug inffo :(
But doesnt a shorter time limit prompt quick blocking from whatsapp server?
Perhaps the no send problem problem is a caching problem?
Nope, you've got 99 problems but the cache ain't one.

Besides, cache is explicitly set to false in all AJAX calls
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/src/php/ajaxDemo/index.php#L94
Ok Thanks. Soo why does it send better when the time limit is reduced?
What are the problems with setting a low time limit?

Hi, the WhatsAPI project is being supported here: https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official

What's the debug output?

Also, make sure you use the same identity you used to register the number.

Hi ...
Thanks for the reply.  Actually, there is no output at all, I just want the correct php code

Regards.

On Oct 16, 2014 1:22 AM, mgp25 <notifications@github.com> wrote:
Hi, the WhatsAPI project is being supported here: https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official

What's the debug output?

Also, make sure you use the same identity you used to register the number.

---
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/401#issuecomment-59286490
@mgp25 ...please check my last comment
@mgp25 ... thank you ... but it did not show the new password ... only "Password is" ... while when I check using WART then the result is successful
You registered the number using WART, WhatsAPI has different identity generation, you must use the same identity in order to use checkCredentials
It seems you are not using the same identity you used when you registered the number, or you never registered that number.
@mgp25  ... I did .. I changed the identity to the same generated one, and still the same problem
Then you have a problem with the identity, try registering again.
@mgp25 ... yes ... I found it ... thank you.  the problem with in the md5($username) ... I am sure there is a way to change the md5($username)  to something matching WART.
not receiveing sms code on mobile... please help me
I believe the new WART has a problem ... it does not generate a new password.

Hi... All,


I am not able to receive request code.
And in exampleRequest.php, I am using following code:

$username = "918010201735";
$identity = strtolower(urlencode(sha1($username, true)));
$w = new WhatsProt($username, $identity, "HDINT", true);
$w->codeRequest();

--------------------------exampleRequest.php ends here and should send a message to my number-----------

Execution Result display: 

Array
(
    [method] => sms
    [in] => 8010201735
    [cc] => 91
    [id] => %d3%a6%5c3r%b1%e2%ee%1f%db%cb%17%c3rs%b0%1c%bc%11%d5
    [lg] => hi
    [lc] => IN
    [token] => wa8F5qkL8bdGtxuuagmLDxf%2Bo2Y%3D
    [sim_mcc] => 000
    [sim_mnc] => 000
)
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail
    [reason] => old_version
)

------------------------------------------------------
No Message i got.
-----------------------------------



Please help me friends as i have been searching on this from 2 days.
i tried registering but showing no_routes.............Please help

Dear All...

Is it necessary to put sim inside the mobile phone while registering/requesting for code via sms/call because while requesting for code it is showing :

By Wart:
SMS: {status:fail, reason: no_routes, retry_after: 3600}
Voice: {status:fail, reason: no_routes, retry_after: 3600}

& By exampleRegister.php

Array
(
[in] => 8010202508
[cc] => 91
[id] => %93%c6%7f%38%a5%c2%4b%02%a0%d8%9e%54%c8%e0%6f%5a
[lg] => hi
[lc] => IN
[mcc] => 000
[mnc] => 000
[sim_mcc] => 404
[sim_mnc] => 000
[method] => sms
[reason] => self-send-jailbroken
[token] => elT4fXmNLXnunctHOv%2BZdkVWI4o%3D
[network_radio_type] => 1
)
stdClass Object
(
[status] => fail
[reason] => no_routes
[retry_after] => 3600
)

So i have to change sim every time & it is very tough to put sim inside phone every time.

So help me in both case:
1. no_routes
2. Sim in side mobile or not

title: Using WhatsAPI on an old phone
